name: House of 1833

reviews.title: Best bathtub of our 21 day holiday!!
reviews.text: It is difficult to know where to begin. The House of 1833 was truly awesome, even in the midst of winter! The house is a huge Greek Revival Mansion. Evan and Robert must have been collecting furniture and knick-knacks for years as they furnished it in less than a month. It won't be to everyone's taste but is is so completely over the top that it is wonderful to behold.

reviews.title: Perfect getaway
reviews.text: Our bed was very comfortable and the bath was the best I had during our whole holiday. I was sad that we had only decided to stay one night.

reviews.title: Just Peachy!
reviews.text: Robert was so thoughtful and made us scones--we are from Scotland--for breakfast and considering it was only his second attempt they were very good as was the rest of the meal. Their restaurant recommendation for dinner was excellent and we really enjoyed our meal.

reviews.title: Yearly ritual
reviews.text: However, the best part, for me was their dog Spuds. I would not hesitate a heartbeat to recommend this place to anyone. Go and enjoy!

reviews.title: Great place to stay and very romantic!! A+++
reviews.text: We have stayed here twice so far (November 2005 and March 2006). The innkeepers, Robert and Evan, are just fabulous!.....Smart, funny, polite, and true gentlemen. I have a terrible time with directions and they are extremely gracious about my shortcomings (maybe next time I won't get lost!). The breakfasts are yummy and huge and made while you wait. It is also enjoyable chatting with them in the kitchen. If you sleep a bit late (like I do), breakfast will still be made. I'd tell you the room we stayed in, but....they are all fabulous so I'll keep mine a secret!

description: The House of 1833 is A Greek Revival Mansion & National Landmark on 3 acres of gardens and fountains featuring a seasonal full-size swimming pool & including a full New England country-gourmet candlelight breakfast; all guest suites feature full private bath, working wood-burning fireplaces, air conditioning, cable, am/fm CD players, 19th c. antique furnishings...four of the suites with over-sized jacuzzi hot tubs and HD flat panel TV, two with private garden porches.
